meanings.sent1: The small room felt stuffy and hot without any windows.
meanings.sent2: The closed windows made the classroom feel stuffy and uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The stuffy attic was like a sauna, making everyone sweat.
meanings.sent4: The stuffy elevator felt like a suffocating box with no air.
meanings.sent5: The stuffy closet was so airless, it felt like a sealed box.

meanings.sent1: After crying, her nose felt stuffy and blocked.
meanings.sent2: His allergies made him feel stuffy and congested all day.
meanings.sent3: The stuffy nose made her sound like a trumpet when she spoke.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts felt stuffy and clogged, unable to flow freely.
meanings.sent5: The stuffy feeling in his chest made it hard to breathe deeply.

meanings.definition: Formal or old-fashioned in style or manner
meanings.sent1: The stuffy old man insisted on wearing a suit to the beach.
meanings.sent2: The stuffy language in the book made it hard to understand.
meanings.sent3: The stuffy party had everyone speaking in a posh accent.
meanings.sent4: Her stuffy manners made her seem out of touch with modern times.
meanings.sent5: The stuffy decor in the restaurant felt like a trip back in time.
